revised_title: Muscle Contraction and Heat Production: The Role of Chemical Changes
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine if chemical changes precede mechanical responses in muscle contractions. Using a thermopile and a sensitive galvanometer, they measured the heat production and mechanical response of stimulated muscle fibers. The results showed that heat production started before any visible shortening, confirming that chemical changes precede mechanical responses in muscle contractions.
